DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine whether lidocaine patch v placebo improve postsurgical neuropathic pain cancer patient . - Compare toxic effect regimens patient . - Compare effect regimens mood state , functional ability , overall quality life patient . OUTLINE : This randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled study . Patients stratify accord etiology pain ( breast surgery v lung surgery v amputation v ) , duration pain ( 1-3 month v 4-6 month v 6 month ) , current analgesic regimen ( opioids [ include tramadol ] v antidepressant vs anticonvulsant vs combination v v none ) . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive lidocaine transdermal patch ( 3 patch ) apply directly painful area 18 hour daily . Treatment continue 4 week absence unacceptable toxicity . At end week 4 , patient cross arm II . - Arm II : Patients receive placebo transdermal patch apply painful area arm I . At end week 4 , patient cross arm I . Pain quality life assess baseline week 4 8 . Patients follow 3-7 day . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 100 patient ( 50 per treatment arm ) accrue study .
